demos.title: Signals Basics
demos.teaches: Create reactive state with signal(). Use computed() for derived state and effect() for side effects. Read values with calling the signal as function, update with .set() and .update().

demos.title: HTTP Resource & Signals
demos.teaches: Fetch data reactively with httpResource(). Respond to signal changes automatically. Handle loading states and errors with resource computed signals.

demos.title: Deep Signal Changes
demos.teaches: Track nested changes within signal objects using deep equality checks. Understand when signals notify dependent computations.

demos.title: Component Inputs with Signals
demos.teaches: Define typed component inputs as signals using input() and input.required(). Use with two-way binding in parent components.

demos.title: Model Two-Way Binding
demos.teaches: Implement two-way binding with model() signal API. Parent and child components sync data mutually without manual event handling.

demos.title: Container-Presenter with Signals
demos.teaches: Apply Container-Presenter pattern using signals. Container manages state and httpResource data, Presenter displays UI. Pass data and callbacks to child presenters.

demos.title: Signals EventBus
demos.teaches: Create a lightweight event bus with signals for cross-component communication. Emit and subscribe to events without RxJS.

demos.title: RxJS to Signals Bridge
demos.teaches: Convert RxJS Observables to signals with toSignal(). Create writeable signals from async sources. Combine signals with existing Observable code.

demos.title: NgRx selectSignal Integration
demos.teaches: Use NgRx selectSignal() to derive signals directly from store state. Type-safe store integration without subscribe patterns.

demos.title: OnPush & Zoneless CD
demos.teaches: Run Angular with zoneless change detection using signals. Remove NgZone dependency and improve performance with pure signal-based reactivity.

demos.title: HTTP Resource API
demos.teaches: Load and display async data with httpResource(). Handle loading state, errors, and display data conditionally in templates.

comments.title: Using @ngrx/store
comments.comment: To use @ngrx/store, we need to install it first.

comments.title: Optimizing change detection
comments.comment: In order to optimize change detection, we need to use OnPush strategy.
